newsitem.title: FRANCE: Bouygues unit wins Indonesia contract.
newsitem.headline: Bouygues unit wins Indonesia contract.

text.p: Bouygues subsidiary DTP (Dragages et Travaux Publics ) has signed a contract to build a residential complex in the Indonesian capital of Djakarta for around 600 million francs, the French building group said on Monday.

It said in a statement that construction had begun on the 276,000 square metre project of Indonesian developer Kuningan Persada and the complex is due to be completed in July 1999. It will include a commercial complex and four, 44-floor towers, providing more than 1,900 residences each.
